CONNOISSEUR.Definition: someone who knows a lot about them

DIVE INTO.Definition: start dealing with them in an exciting way

ZEALOUS.Definition: showing great energy or passion about something

WIDESPREAD.Definition: existing or happening among many people

DISTILLATION.Definition: the process of making a drink stronger

PIONEERED.Definition: been the first who had done it

INSULATION.Definition: the process of protecting it from the heat

PROHIBITION.Definition: a period in American history when the sale, production, and transportation of alcoholic drinks was made illegal

BARTENDER.Definition: someone whose job was to make and serve drinks in a bar

LO AND BEHOLD.Definition: look and see, something that you say when you tell someone about something surprising that happened

ALLERGIC.Definition: having a condition that caused illness when he had certain drinks

TABASCO.Definition: a sauce with a strong taste

TA-DA.Definition: used to show that something is impressive or surprising

CULT.Definition: popular among a certain group of people

NICHE.Definition: interesting for a small specialised group of people

SCREWDRIVER.Definition: a tool with a flattened or cross-shaped tip that fits into the head of a screw to turn it

BLISSFULLY.Definition: in a way that provides perfect happiness or great joy

INDISTINGUISHABLE.Definition: not able to be identified as different

BARTENDERS.Definition: people whose job was to make and serve drinks in a bar
